title: Calculation of central bank bond purchase effect

content.question: Assume that the required reserve ratio is 10 percent and the banking system has limited reserves. If the central bank buys $1,000 of bonds from commercial banks, which of the following will occur?

choices.label: The money supply will increase by a maximum of <math alttext="$1,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$1,000</mtext></math>.
There will be a maximum of <math alttext="$9,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$9,000</mtext></math> of new loans made by all banks.
Demand deposits will increase by a maximum of <math alttext="$9,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$9,000</mtext></math>.
The amount of new cash reserves injected into the banking system will be <math alttext="$100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$100</mtext></math>.
The money supply will increase by a maximum of <math alttext="$10,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$10,000</mtext></math>.

content.answer: The money supply will increase by a maximum of <math alttext="$10,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$10,000</mtext></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
